intro: Euploca ocellata, commonly known as the spotted flax or false flax, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Euploca ocellata thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It is considered a valuable plant for ecological restoration due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
